page.title: 03RIVER AVON, STRENSHAM
page.content:
The{Lower Avon Navigational Trust } governs this stretch of the river and its members, over the last twenty years, have restored it to a busy waterway by cleaning the banks, restoring the locks and dredging to prevent flooding.
The river is used entirely for recreation and in summer, a large number of boats pass through the locks and use the permanent moorings on its banks. In recent years, the{narrow} {boat}has become popular and many are hired during the season. { {Strensham Marina,}near Defford, plays host to a sailing club used by Malvern College and also, the Arden Sailing Club. Its buildings are small and functional and the Marina cannot be classed as a public amenity.
